speaker: Common Room
lines: Benches creak and settle as new faces take their places.
Serving hands ferry bowls of stew from pot to table.
Cards slap the wood; dice murmur in a leather cup.
A gray cat keeps the hearth and naps with one eye open.
The rafters are black with years of smoke and stories.
A scarred man listens more than he speaks.
Someone swears they saw a ghost once; someone else swears they didn't.
The door to the alley sticks when the damp comes in.

choices.text: Drop a coin for the bard and listen.
Slip into the alley for air.
